Package model

Class GameModel

java.lang.Object
model.GameModel
public class GameModel extends Object
Represents the GameModel class which manages the game data and logic.

    • startUpPhase

      public void startUpPhase() throws Exception

      This method initializes the startup phase of the game.

      • This method enqueues all players.
      • It then iterates through all available countries on the map.
      • A loop is executed until all countries are assigned to players.
      • Countries are randomly assigned to players and removed from the available list.
      • After assigning countries to players, it calls the AssignReinforcementArmies method.
      Throws:
      Exception - if there are no players in the list.

    • assignReinforcementArmies

      public void assignReinforcementArmies() throws Exception
      /** This method assigns armies to the players.
      • It first checks if the size of the player list is greater than 0.
      • If the size is greater than 0, it calculates the number of armies to assign based on the number of countries assigned to the player divided by 3.
      • If a player controls a complete continent, the continent's value is added to the player's army count.
      • The method then uses the maximum function to ensure that players receive a minimum of 3 armies if their calculated army count is less than 3, otherwise, it assigns the maximum possible armies.
      • Once the respective armies have been determined for each player, the method sets the player's army count accordingly.
      Throws:
      Exception - If there are no players.
